pros: Now in our second year, we are "Great Place to Work" Certified. We've added lots of employee benefits and employee appreciation-focused events. Even during the pandemic, our teams came together to focus on employee morale, offering a "healthcare hero" t-shirt and branded sunglasses to all employees at no cost. We added new items for branded apparel options and appreciation meals/food trucks throughout the year too. We have a 403b matching program, a partial gym reimbursement option, an EAP program, job-related tuition reimbursement, cell phone reimbursement, and milage reimbursement.
cons: Due to company size, not a lot of internal growth potential.

review_title: Patient-centered care and great team environment
job_title: Print & Social Media Coordinator in Belleville, IL
pros:
I love my team and supervisor who are supportive and always working hard to help patients and families in the communities we serve. We have stellar nurses, hospice aides, social workers, and bereavement counselors who are so compassionate to our patients and helping their families through the end of life and grief journey. 

I love the flexibility in my position to do what I love and have the ability to grow and thrive. I get to work with lots of departments and share all the amazing things everyone in our organization does to contribute to the  excellent care to our patients. 

Other perks of working at Hospice of Southern Illinois: the vacation time is awesome, retirement (403b) program, management is willing to listen to suggestions and work towards a solution, partial reimbursement for gym memberships, employee incentive program for Hospice of Southern Illinois swag/clothing and wellness rewards, the location is near lots of food/shops for lunch and after work, and I love the color burgundy (encouraged to wear as often as possible).
cons: Nights and weekends can be involved due to the nature of hospice care, healthcare is 24/7.

pros: There is a very supportive work environment

review_title: I believe in the mission of Hospice of Southern Ilinois
pros: I have worked for Hospice of Southern Illinois for over 10 years, during that time there has been many, many changes in the hospice industry. I am proud that Hospice of Southern Illinois has stayed true to its mission.  Working with many wonderful and compassionate people both past and present and both in the clinical as well as administrative areas makes me still very happy to come to work everyday.  I take pride in knowing that what we do helps to make the end of life process better for the people in the communities that I call home.
cons: As rewarding as hospice care is, it  not an easy career. However if you are at a place in your life/career that it is a good fit.  You will not find anything more rewarding.

review_title: The worst place I have ever worked!  Management is terrible
pros: Worked for this company for five years.  The nursing job itself, dealing with patients and families can be rewarding when the company allows you to give them the comfort measures that they need.  Time off policies are okay.
cons:
Personal growth is limited.  Compensation is lower than average.  You may work 12 hours a day them be dismissed early on a random day during the week to prevent overtime.  The CEO and upper management reminds the employees frequently that they are at will and may be fired for no reason.  Employees are encouraged to write each other up for every small incident.  Morale is terrible across the board.  
Patients are shown favoritism, Depends on the family or if the particular person has money or a position of influence will determine what services or supplies are provided.  
The organization is horrible and it starts with the CEO on down.

Getting a history lesson about their lives and what they did for a living, how long they was married to their spouse, where they meet. Holding their hand as they sing or tell me something that is important to them. The team work between staff laughing with many of our sisters/brothers from the team.
